formattedAddress: 150 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 150 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, USA

editorialSummary.text: Fast-food chain offering Mexican fare, including design-your-own burritos, tacos & bowls.

originalText.text: Craved Chipotle and decided to come here during the lunch rush. They ran out of chicken, so I got a steak bowl instead. They put ample amount of food inside and you can always ask for extras inside your bowl. The workers are FAST. Almost too fast, the tortilla was pipping hot through the aluminum foil. Would come here again, I was a fat and satisfied customer.

They put ample amount of food inside and you can always ask for extras inside your bowl. The workers are FAST. Almost too fast, the tortilla was pipping hot through the aluminum foil. Would come here again, I was a fat and satisfied customer.

originalText.text: there is a reason this chipotle is empty. they do not give adequate scoops, and also i paid for a full bag of chips and i’ve had chipotle countless times at other locations and none of what i ate tasted correctly. do not go here, you will be disappointed. all pictures attached are what they gave me, i had not eaten a thing.

originalText.text:
Update, July: food was fresh and flavourful. Portions were very generous. Staff was kind

Great location, food is always fresh and flavourful and they are up to chipotle serving sizes as many other locations put less than what they are supposed to. Staff are kind and it is always clean and welcoming to sit inside and eat

originalText.text: We got a carne asada bowl and they provide so little portions of the meat for $14. I use to work at chipotle and I know that’s not the right serving. The lady serving gave the nastiest attitude and I asked why so little. Will not be returning

text.text: We got a carne asada bowl and they provide so little portions of the meat for $14. I use to work at chipotle and I know that’s not the right serving. The lady serving gave the nastiest attitude and I asked why so little. Will not be returning

originalText.text:
Not sure if it was an off day of what was happening, but lunch hour at any chipotle is always busy. I came in for a bowl, I got everything I needed but when it came down to making sure everything I asked for was in the bowl there was a slight misunderstanding. They were super busy, but definitely no excuse for them to be mixing up people’s orders and being unsure of what to ring up for each customer. I know they were trying to be efficient by passing the orders down the line as fast as possible but then it caused slight chaos where the person was 3 people behind their corresponding order. Meaning that my order was ahead of me next to the register and I had not even been rung up yet at the register yet and was behind 3 people waiting to pay for theirs.

As a result, I did not get the lettuce I asked for which is fine no biggie, just slightly annoying after having to wait to order my food. On top of that, the woman at the register must’ve been new or being trained during a busy shift because she was not charging anyone correctly or understanding who had ordered what. I also tried to use my rewards on my chipotle app for free side of guac and that was not applied to my final total. ALSO to really ruin my experience at this particular location, my guac was slightly discolored with a gray tone. There was also a large, solid hard piece of a raw and possibly rotting avocado in my side of guac that I had to pay for. Overall, 2/5 ⭐️
